VEC.Q: How many ridgelines are in this ridgeline chart?
VEC.A: There are {7} slices in this chart.

SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Container Ship relative to the peak of Courier Services in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Container Ship is to the {right} of the peak of Courier Services.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing Pipeline show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing Pipeline shows a {Single Peak Distribution}.

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Rail Freight} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =17806.2?
EVJ.A: At X =17806.2,the label with the highest density is {Rail Freight}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 30987? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Container Ship}'s peak at {40791},{Barge}'s peak at {41241},{Cargo Truck}'s peak at {40891}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 34736? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Rail Freight}'s peak at {24358},{Pipeline}'s peak at {5606},{Air Cargo}'s peak at {5641},{Courier Services}'s peak at {4555}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Container Ship or Pipeline?
NC.A: {Container Ship} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Pipeline or Air Cargo?
NC.A: {Air Cargo} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Courier Services or Air Cargo?
NC.A: {Air Cargo} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {3} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Rail Freight}
